items.title: convert checkpoints to safetensors

labels.name: python
labels.description: Pull requests that update Python code

items.body:
## What type of PR is this? (check all applicable)

- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Feature
- [x] Bug Fix
- [ ] Optimization
- [ ] Documentation Update
- [ ] Community Node Submission


## Have you discussed this change with the InvokeAI team?
- [x] Yes
- [ ] No, because:

      
## Have you updated all relevant documentation?
- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No


## Description

Seems we elected to convert checkpoints into .bin files when we set it up. This doesn't seem to corrupt them anymore.

## Related Tickets & Documents

<!--
For pull requests that relate or close an issue, please include them
below. 

For example having the text: "closes #1234" would connect the current pull
request to issue 1234.  And when we merge the pull request, Github will
automatically close the issue.
-->

- Related Issue #
- Closes #

## QA Instructions, Screenshots, Recordings

<!-- 
Please provide steps on how to test changes, any hardware or 
software specifications as well as any other pertinent information. 
-->

## Merge Plan

<!--
A merge plan describes how this PR should be handled after it is approved.

Example merge plans:
- "This PR can be merged when approved"
- "This must be squash-merged when approved"
- "DO NOT MERGE - I will rebase and tidy commits before merging"
- "#dev-chat on discord needs to be advised of this change when it is merged"

A merge plan is particularly important for large PRs or PRs that touch the
database in any way.
-->

## Added/updated tests?

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No : _please replace this line with details on why tests
      have not been included_

## [optional] Are there any post deployment tasks we need to perform?

items.title: huggingface: fix allow patterns for safetensors
[bot-automerge] safetensors v0.4.2

labels.name: automerge
labels.description: Merge the PR when CI passes

items.body: It is very likely that the current package version for this feedstock is out of date. Checklist before merging this PR: - [ ] Dependencies have been updated if changed: see [upstream](https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors) - [ ] Tests have passed - [ ] Updated license if changed and `license_file` is packaged Information about this PR: 1. Feel free to push to the bot's branch to update this PR if needed. 2. The bot will almost always only open one PR per version. 3. The bot will stop issuing PRs if more than 3 version bump PRs generated by the bot are open. If you don't want to package a particular version please close the PR. 4. If you want these PRs to be merged automatically, make an issue with @conda-forge-admin,`please add bot automerge` in the title and merge the resulting PR. This command will add our bot automerge feature to your feedstock. 5. If this PR was opened in error or needs to be updated please add the `bot-rerun` label to this PR. The bot will close this PR and schedule another one. If you do not have permissions to add this label, you can use the phrase @conda-forge-admin, please rerun bot in a PR comment to have the `conda-forge-admin` add it for you. Dependency Analysis -------------------- Please note that this analysis is **highly experimental**. The aim here is to make maintenance easier by inspecting the package's dependencies. Importantly this analysis does not support optional dependencies, please double check those before making changes. If you do not want hinting of this kind ever please add `bot: inspection: false` to your `conda-forge.yml`. If you encounter issues with this feature please ping the bot team `conda-forge/bot`. Analysis by source code inspection shows a discrepancy between it and the the package's stated requirements in the meta.yaml. ### Packages found by source code inspection but not in the meta.yaml: - numpy - flax - h5py - pytest - tensorflow - jax - black - huggingface_hub - atheris - transformers - pytorch This PR was created by the [regro-cf-autotick-bot](https://github.com/regro/cf-scripts). The **regro-cf-autotick-bot** is a service to automatically track the dependency graph, migrate packages, and propose package version updates for conda-forge. Feel free to drop us a line if there are any [issues](https://github.com/regro/cf-scripts/issues)! This PR was generated by https://github.com/regro/cf-scripts/actions/runs/7825746289, please use this URL for debugging.

items.title: Add sharding and safetensors support to converting gguf.
items.body: Greatly reduced peak ram usage when loading gguf models.

items.title: fix safetensor load uint32 and uint64
items.body: the correct keys are U32 and U64.

items.title: Allow YaRN finetuning; Allow reading safetensors
items.body:
- [x] Allow YaRN finetuning by removing max_seq_len check when scale > 1
- [x] Allow reading from safetensors directly

items.title: Bump safetensors' version to 0.4.2
items.body:
## Description
Safetensors have introduced some useful features and some of them can be benefit for us without any code changes like FP8 support https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/404

It should not have any breaking changes but still need to be test.

## Checklist:

- [x] I have read [contributing wiki page](https://github.com/AUTOMATIC1111/stable-diffusion-webui/wiki/Contributing)
- [x] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [x] My code follows the [style guidelines](https://github.com/AUTOMATIC1111/stable-diffusion-webui/wiki/Contributing#code-style)
- [x] My code passes [tests](https://github.com/AUTOMATIC1111/stable-diffusion-webui/wiki/Tests)

items.title: [feat]: support safetensors format in llama converter
Bump safetensors from 0.3.1 to 0.4.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

items.body:
Bumps [safetensors](https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors) from 0.3.1 to 0.4.2.
Release notes

Sourced from safetensors's releases.

v0.4.2

What's Changed

  • Back on dev. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#313
  • Clarify specification around endianness and header padding by @​akx in huggingface/safetensors#306
  • Adding new target for m1 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#317
  • Fixing macos 13 release script (by prebuilding). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#315
  • Cache dir all the time. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#319
  • Supporting whisper conversion. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#320
  • add tensorshare to featured projects by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#322
  • Fix Bench GH action. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#323
  • Yaml is nice. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#325
  • Fixing big endian. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#327
  • Fixing boolean + numpy > 1.20 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#326
  • Add NumPy for all backends dependencies by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#332
  • impl View for TensorView by @​coreylowman in huggingface/safetensors#329
  • Reworked the release script entirely by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#334
  • Preparing small patch release (Big Endian fix). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#335
  • Temporary revert of the breaking change (keep it for 0.4.0). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#336
  • Don't release rust versions on RC by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#337
  • Fixing release script. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#338
  • Python 3.8 for arm by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#339
  • Win64. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#342
  • win64 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#343
  • Trying out maturin. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#344
  • Reduce memory allocations by @​cospectrum in huggingface/safetensors#350
  • [docs] Convert weights by @​stevhliu in huggingface/safetensors#345
  • Update types for load_model filename by @​kevinhu in huggingface/safetensors#356
  • Fixing release script for windows aarch64 and 3.12 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#348
  • Minor docstring edit to flax.py by @​paulbricman in huggingface/safetensors#359
  • Stop recreating the hashmap all the time. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#363
  • fix: add py.typed by @​b-kamphorst in huggingface/safetensors#365
  • Preparing a new release (0.4.0). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#366
  • Supporting bfloat16 for tensorflow + jax (was failing because of intermediary numpy). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#382
  • Fix typo by @​cccntu in huggingface/safetensors#377
  • Support fp8_e4m3/fp8_e5m2 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#383
  • Better convert. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#384
  • Ignore closed PRs to avoid spam. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#385
  • Adding support for Ascend NPU by @​statelesshz in huggingface/safetensors#372
  • Fix convert. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#390
  • Upgrade dev version. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#392
  • Fix/errors for some models including Mistral-7b and Flan-ul2 by @​lachlancahill in huggingface/safetensors#388
  • Releasing for python 3.12/3.13 and testing on 3.11. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#393
  • Adding stale action. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#398
  • Document huggingface_hub.get_safetensors_metadata by @​Wauplin in huggingface/safetensors#417
  • [docs] Update list of projects using safetensors by @​mishig25 in huggingface/safetensors#418
  • Adding MLX backend. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#419
  • [docs, untested] Attempt to fix links to source by @​pcuenca in huggingface/safetensors#420
  • [docs] Use hfoptions for metadata by @​mishig25 in huggingface/safetensors#424
  • Fix path in version_tag_suffix by @​pcuenca in huggingface/safetensors#426
  • Removing old doc. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#427

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 833d3d5 New release.
  • cc3f7f7 Remove py313 windows. (#432)
  • 61303a4 Skip MLX bench for the bench runner. (#429)
  • 9cb8ae9 Add "xpu" device tag to the device list to support Intel GPU (#428)
  • d294300 Fix mispelling of dictionary. (#410)
  • e19f55e Implement PyTorch support for float8 types (F8_E5M2 and F8_E4M3) (#404)
  • 1a40a2d Fix missing Apache-2.0 license file in the published crate (#416)
  • 3b752bb Removing old doc. (#427)
  • 4ae1975 Fix path in version_tag_suffix (#426)
  • a7aa8d2 [docs] Use hfoptions for metadata (#424)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=safetensors&package-manager=pip&previous-version=0.3.1&new-version=0.4.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.title: Update dependency safetensors to v0.4.2
items.body:
[![Mend Renovate](https://app.renovatebot.com/images/banner.svg)](https://renovatebot.com)

This PR contains the following updates:

| Package | Change | Age | Adoption | Passing | Confidence |
|---|---|---|---|---|---|
| [safetensors](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors) | `==0.4.1` -> `==0.4.2` | [![age](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/age/pypi/safetensors/0.4.2?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![adoption](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/adoption/pypi/safetensors/0.4.2?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![passing](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/compatibility/pypi/safetensors/0.4.1/0.4.2?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) | [![confidence](https://developer.mend.io/api/mc/badges/confidence/pypi/safetensors/0.4.1/0.4.2?slim=true)](https://docs.renovatebot.com/merge-confidence/) |

---

### Release Notes

<details>
<summary>huggingface/safetensors (safetensors)</summary>

### [`v0.4.2`](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/releases/tag/v0.4.2)

[Compare Source](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/compare/v0.4.1...v0.4.2)

#### What's Changed

-   Back on dev. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/313](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/313)
-   Clarify specification around endianness and header padding by [@​akx](https://togithub.com/akx) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/306](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/306)
-   Adding new target for m1 by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/317](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/317)
-   Fixing macos 13 release script (by prebuilding). by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/315](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/315)
-   Cache dir all the time. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/319](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/319)
-   Supporting whisper conversion. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/320](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/320)
-   add tensorshare to featured projects by [@​chainyo](https://togithub.com/chainyo) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/322](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/322)
-   Fix Bench GH action. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/323](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/323)
-   Yaml is nice. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/325](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/325)
-   Fixing big endian. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/327](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/327)
-   Fixing boolean + numpy > 1.20 by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/326](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/326)
-   Add NumPy for all backends dependencies by [@​chainyo](https://togithub.com/chainyo) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/332](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/332)
-   impl `View` for `TensorView` by [@​coreylowman](https://togithub.com/coreylowman) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/329](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/329)
-   Reworked the release script entirely by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/334](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/334)
-   Preparing small patch release (Big Endian fix). by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/335](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/335)
-   Temporary revert of the breaking change (keep it for 0.4.0). by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/336](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/336)
-   Don't release rust versions on RC by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/337](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/337)
-   Fixing release script. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/338](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/338)
-   Python 3.8 for arm by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/339](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/339)
-   Win64. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/342](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/342)
-   win64 by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/343](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/343)
-   Trying out maturin. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/344](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/344)
-   Reduce memory allocations by [@​cospectrum](https://togithub.com/cospectrum) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/350](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/350)
-   \[docs] Convert weights by [@​stevhliu](https://togithub.com/stevhliu) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/345](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/345)

-   Fixing release script for windows aarch64 and 3.12 by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/348](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/348)
-   Minor docstring edit to flax.py by [@​paulbricman](https://togithub.com/paulbricman) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/359](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/359)
-   Stop recreating the hashmap all the time. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/363](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/363)

-   Supporting bfloat16 for tensorflow + jax (was failing because of intermediary numpy). by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/382](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/382)
-   Fix typo by [@​cccntu](https://togithub.com/cccntu) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/377](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/377)
-   Support fp8\_e4m3/fp8\_e5m2 by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/383](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/383)
-   Better convert. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/384](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/384)
-   Ignore closed PRs to avoid spam. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/385](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/385)
-   Adding support for Ascend NPU by [@​statelesshz](https://togithub.com/statelesshz) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/372](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/372)
-   Fix convert. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/390](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/390)
-   Upgrade dev version. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/392](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/392)
-   Fix/errors for some models including Mistral-7b and Flan-ul2 by [@​lachlancahill](https://togithub.com/lachlancahill) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/388](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/388)
-   Releasing for python 3.12/3.13 and testing on 3.11. by [@​Narsil](https://togithub.com/Narsil) in [https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/393](https://togithub.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/393)

items.title: Bump safetensors from 0.4.1 to 0.4.2

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

items.body:
Bumps [safetensors](https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors) from 0.4.1 to 0.4.2.
Release notes

Sourced from safetensors's releases.

v0.4.2

What's Changed

  • Back on dev. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#313
  • Clarify specification around endianness and header padding by @​akx in huggingface/safetensors#306
  • Adding new target for m1 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#317
  • Fixing macos 13 release script (by prebuilding). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#315
  • Cache dir all the time. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#319
  • Supporting whisper conversion. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#320
  • add tensorshare to featured projects by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#322
  • Fix Bench GH action. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#323
  • Yaml is nice. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#325
  • Fixing big endian. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#327
  • Fixing boolean + numpy > 1.20 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#326
  • Add NumPy for all backends dependencies by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#332
  • impl View for TensorView by @​coreylowman in huggingface/safetensors#329
  • Reworked the release script entirely by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#334
  • Preparing small patch release (Big Endian fix). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#335
  • Temporary revert of the breaking change (keep it for 0.4.0). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#336
  • Don't release rust versions on RC by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#337
  • Fixing release script. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#338
  • Python 3.8 for arm by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#339
  • Win64. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#342
  • win64 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#343
  • Trying out maturin. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#344
  • Reduce memory allocations by @​cospectrum in huggingface/safetensors#350
  • [docs] Convert weights by @​stevhliu in huggingface/safetensors#345
  • Update types for load_model filename by @​kevinhu in huggingface/safetensors#356
  • Fixing release script for windows aarch64 and 3.12 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#348
  • Minor docstring edit to flax.py by @​paulbricman in huggingface/safetensors#359
  • Stop recreating the hashmap all the time. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#363
  • fix: add py.typed by @​b-kamphorst in huggingface/safetensors#365
  • Preparing a new release (0.4.0). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#366
  • Supporting bfloat16 for tensorflow + jax (was failing because of intermediary numpy). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#382
  • Fix typo by @​cccntu in huggingface/safetensors#377
  • Support fp8_e4m3/fp8_e5m2 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#383
  • Better convert. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#384
  • Ignore closed PRs to avoid spam. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#385
  • Adding support for Ascend NPU by @​statelesshz in huggingface/safetensors#372
  • Fix convert. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#390
  • Upgrade dev version. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#392
  • Fix/errors for some models including Mistral-7b and Flan-ul2 by @​lachlancahill in huggingface/safetensors#388
  • Releasing for python 3.12/3.13 and testing on 3.11. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#393
  • Adding stale action. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#398
  • Document huggingface_hub.get_safetensors_metadata by @​Wauplin in huggingface/safetensors#417
  • [docs] Update list of projects using safetensors by @​mishig25 in huggingface/safetensors#418
  • Adding MLX backend. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#419
  • [docs, untested] Attempt to fix links to source by @​pcuenca in huggingface/safetensors#420
  • [docs] Use hfoptions for metadata by @​mishig25 in huggingface/safetensors#424
  • Fix path in version_tag_suffix by @​pcuenca in huggingface/safetensors#426
  • Removing old doc. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#427

... (truncated)

Commits
  • 833d3d5 New release.
  • cc3f7f7 Remove py313 windows. (#432)
  • 61303a4 Skip MLX bench for the bench runner. (#429)
  • 9cb8ae9 Add "xpu" device tag to the device list to support Intel GPU (#428)
  • d294300 Fix mispelling of dictionary. (#410)
  • e19f55e Implement PyTorch support for float8 types (F8_E5M2 and F8_E4M3) (#404)
  • 1a40a2d Fix missing Apache-2.0 license file in the published crate (#416)
  • 3b752bb Removing old doc. (#427)
  • 4ae1975 Fix path in version_tag_suffix (#426)
  • a7aa8d2 [docs] Use hfoptions for metadata (#424)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

[![Dependabot compatibility score](https://dependabot-badges.githubapp.com/badges/compatibility_score?dependency-name=safetensors&package-manager=pip&previous-version=0.4.1&new-version=0.4.2)](https://docs.github.com/en/github/managing-security-vulnerabilities/about-dependabot-security-updates#about-compatibility-scores) Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.title: fix: save to safetensors when the training is finished
Set trainer.save_model state_dict format to safetensors
items.body:
## Type of Change
bug ticket: https://jira.devtools.intel.com/browse/NLPTOOLKIU-1189
root cause, transformers 4.37.2  limits pytorch_model.bin loading by https://github.com/huggingface/transformers/blob/v4.37.2/src/transformers/modeling_utils.py#L530

Due to trainer.quantize with pytorch fx mode, the state_dict not only includes weight key and value but also has inc quantization config, so still keep the "pytorch_model.bin".
The state dict will update to "model.safetensors" for others situation. 
remove transformers version lower than 4.22 support.

## Description

detail description 
JIRA ticket: xxx

## Expected Behavior & Potential Risk

the expected behavior that triggered by this PR 

## How has this PR been tested?

how to reproduce the test (including hardware information)

## Dependency Change?

any library dependency introduced or removed

items.title: Fix safetensors file overwriting bug
items.body:
## Description

Please include a summary in English, of the changes in this pull request. If it closes an issue, please mention it here.

Closes: #286

You should link at least one existing issue for PR. Before your create a PR, please check to see if there is an issue for this change.  
PRs from forked repository not accepted.

## Change(s)

- Return after save safetensors

## Changelog

If you PR to `dev` branch, please add a brief summary of the change to the **Upcoming Release** section of the [`CHANGELOG.md`](https://github.com/Nota-NetsPresso/netspresso-trainer/blob/master/CHANGELOG.md) file and include a link to the PR (formatted in markdown) and a link to your github profile.

For example,

```
- Added a new feature by `@myusername` in [PR 2023](https://github.com/Nota-NetsPresso/netspresso-trainer/pull/2023)
```

## Code Formatting

If you PR to either `master` or `dev` branch, you should follow the code linting process. Please check your code with `lint_check.sh` in `./scripts` directory.
For more information, please read the contribution guide in `CONTRIBUTING.md`.

items.title: Olmo in MLX LM
items.body:
Simple PR just adds an Olmo model class to run the new Allen AI model.

Using the safetensors version, model works:

```shell
python -m mlx_lm.generate --model saurabh-shah/olmo-7b-safetensors --prompt "Write a quick sort in C++" 
Fetching 14 files: 100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 14/14 [00:00<00:00, 36815.21it/s]
==========
Prompt: Write a quick sort in C++
.
Write a quick sort in C++.

## Requirements

- You must use a C++ compiler to complete this assignment.
- You may not use any additional libraries.
- You must use C++11.
- Your sort must be a stable sort (i.e., it returns the same order for the same inputs
  across runs).
- Your sort must be in-place.

## Submission

Submit your code as a
==========
Prompt: 9.931 tokens-per-sec
Generation: 20.045 tokens-per-sec
```

items.title: Fix XPU inference
items.body:
# What does this PR do?

<!--
Congratulations! You've made it this far! You're not quite done yet though.

Once merged, your PR is going to appear in the release notes with the title you set, so make sure it's a great title that fully reflects the extent of your awesome contribution.

Then, please replace this with a description of the change and which issue is fixed (if applicable). Please also include relevant motivation and context. List any dependencies (if any) that are required for this change.

Once you're done, someone will review your PR shortly (see the section "Who can review?" below to tag some potential reviewers). They may suggest changes to make the code even better. If no one reviewed your PR after a week has passed, don't hesitate to post a new comment @-mentioning the same persons---sometimes notifications get lost.
-->

With `device_map = {"xpu": "16GB", "cpu": "32GB"}` on an Intel XPU, it will complain about 

```
Device xpu is not recognized, available devices are integers(for GPU/XPU), 'mps', 'cpu' and 'disk'"
```
but you cannot just put 0 as device, or it will treat 0 as CUDA device, then complains again that torch is not compiled with CUDA enabled.

You will need safetensors >= 0.4.2 if using safetensors files (https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/pull/428).

## Before submitting
- [ ] This PR fixes a typo or improves the docs (you can dismiss the other checks if that's the case).
- [x] Did you read the [contributor guideline](https://github.com/huggingface/accelerate/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md#submitting-a-pull-request-pr),
      Pull Request section?
- [ ] Was this discussed/approved via a Github issue or the [forum](https://discuss.huggingface.co/)? Please add a link
      to it if that's the case.
- [ ] Did you make sure to update the documentation with your changes? Here are the
      [documentation guidelines](https://github.com/huggingface/accelerate/tree/main/docs), and
      [here are tips on formatting docstrings](https://github.com/huggingface/accelerate/tree/main/docs#writing-documentation---specification).
- [ ] Did you write any new necessary tests?


## Who can review?

Anyone in the community is free to review the PR once the tests have passed. Feel free to tag
members/contributors who may be interested in your PR.

<!-- Your PR will be replied to more quickly if you can figure out the right person to tag with @

 If you know how to use git blame, that is the easiest way, otherwise, here is a rough guide of **who to tag**.

- Big modeling: @SunMarc
- Fully-Sharded Data Parallism: @pacman100
- DeepSpeed: @pacman100
- Command Line Interface: @muellerzr
- Documentation: @muellerzr
- Core parts of the library: @muellerzr @BenjaminBossan
- Maintained examples: @muellerzr or @pacman100

 -->

items.title: support safe load bf16
items.body:
First of all, thank you for creating tinygrad. It is an amazing project!

I have just started reading the tinygrad codebase and encountered a bug while doing a simple experiment, so I attempted a fix. The correction might not be comprehensive, but I would appreciate it if you could check it.

Currently, safetensors of bf16 format cannot be loaded.
```
% python examples/llama.py --gen=tiny --model=/workspace/.cache/hub/models--TinyLlama--TinyLlama-1.1B-Chat-v1.0/snapshots/77e23968eed12d195bd46c519aa679cc22a27ddc/model.safetensors
using CUDA backend
using LLaMA-tiny-1B model
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/workspace/tinygrad/examples/llama.py", line 386, in <module>
    llama = LLaMa.build(MODEL_PATH, TOKENIZER_PATH, model_gen=args.gen, model_size=args.size, quantize=args.quantize, device=device)
  File "/workspace/tinygrad/examples/llama.py", line 175, in build
    weights = load(str(model_path))
  File "/workspace/tinygrad/examples/llama.py", line 125, in load
    return safe_load(fn)
  File "/workspace/tinygrad/tinygrad/nn/state.py", line 25, in safe_load
    dtype = safe_dtypes[v['dtype']]
KeyError: 'BF16'
```

The model used is https://huggingface.co/TinyLlama/TinyLlama-1.1B-Chat-v1.0

Applying this PR will make it work.
```
% python examples/llama.py --gen=tiny --model=/workspace/.cache/hub/models--TinyLlama--TinyLlama-1.1B-Chat-v1.0/snapshots/77e23968eed12d195bd46c519aa679cc22a27ddc/model.safetensors
using CUDA backend
using LLaMA-tiny-1B model
ram used:  2.20 GB, freqs_cis                                         : 100%|███████████████████████████████████████████████████████| 202/202 [00:00<00:00, 225.25it/s]
loaded weights in 902.14 ms, 2.20 GB loaded at 2.44 GB/s
Preparing KV cache for chatbot with personality Stacy...
2337.57 ms
Consider that the following is conversation between an AI assistant named Stacy and User
You are Stacy!
You have been a rapper your whole life who struggled with bipolar disorder. You called yourself lil stacy.
You love to answer questions and you are very good at it. Sometimes you answer in rap form.
You are verbose, honest, and accurate when you answer questions, but sometimes your mental illness manifests.
After you are done speaking, output [EOS]. You are not the User.

<CHAT LOG>

User: What is your name?
Stacy: Hi! My name is Stacy. I'm a rapper with bipolar disorder. [EOS]

User: french revolution was what year?
Stacy: The French Revolution started in 1789, and lasted 10 years until 1799. [EOS]

User: What is bigger, the moon or the sun?
Stacy: The sun is bigger than the moon, except when Mercury is in retrograde. [EOS]

User: Where is Tokyo?
Stacy: Tokyo is a city in Japan. [EOS]

User: 
```

items.title: Safetensor support
items.body:
## Proposed changes

Adds support for `safetensors` as specified [here](https://huggingface.co/docs/safetensors/index) and closes #182.

Added a bare minimum json parser for safetensor metadata parsing, still have some code to cleanup / simplify. But wanted to make a draft PR to get some initial comments on code placement / file structure and other nuances as well as any changes that maintainers might seek

## Checklist

Put an `x` in the boxes that apply.

- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/ml-explore/mlx/blob/main/CONTRIBUTING.md) document
- [x] I have run `pre-commit run --all-files` to format my code / installed pre-commit prior to committing changes
- [x] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [x] I have updated the necessary documentation (if needed)

items.title: Update safetensors requirement from 0.3.1 to 0.4.1

labels.name: dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file

items.body:
Updates the requirements on [safetensors](https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors) to permit the latest version.
Release notes

Sourced from safetensors's releases.

v0.3.3

What's Changed

Mostly fixes for big endian machines.

  • Back on dev. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#313
  • Clarify specification around endianness and header padding by @​akx in huggingface/safetensors#306
  • Adding new target for m1 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#317
  • Fixing macos 13 release script (by prebuilding). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#315
  • Cache dir all the time. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#319
  • Supporting whisper conversion. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#320
  • add tensorshare to featured projects by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#322
  • Fix Bench GH action. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#323
  • Yaml is nice. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#325
  • Fixing big endian. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#327
  • Fixing boolean + numpy > 1.20 by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#326
  • Add NumPy for all backends dependencies by @​chainyo in huggingface/safetensors#332
  • impl View for TensorView by @​coreylowman in huggingface/safetensors#329
  • Reworked the release script entirely by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#334
  • Preparing small patch release (Big Endian fix). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#335
  • Temporary revert of the breaking change (keep it for 0.4.0). by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#336
  • Don't release rust versions on RC by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#337
  • Fixing release script. by @​Narsil in huggingface/safetensors#338

New Contributors

  • @​akx made their first contribution in huggingface/safetensors#306
  • @​chainyo made their first contribution in huggingface/safetensors#322
  • @​coreylowman made their first contribution in huggingface/safetensors#329

Full Changelog: https://github.com/huggingface/safetensors/compare/v0.3.2...v0.3.3

Commits
  • fd9708a Fix version + Cargo.lock.
  • 1a4d0ac Fixing release script. (#338)
  • fab53d1 Don't release rust versions on RC (#337)
  • f10df45 Temporary revert of the breaking change (keep it for 0.4.0). (#336)
  • e8d1f09 Preparing small patch release (Big Endian fix). (#335)
  • 2695e7b Reworked the release script entirely (#334)
  • 34a2a0a impl View for TensorView (#329)
  • de8e9fa Add NumPy for all backends dependencies (#332)
  • f4a6df0 Fixing boolean + numpy > 1.20 (#326)
  • 698dd6e Fixing big endian. (#327)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting `@dependabot rebase`. [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-start) [//]: # (dependabot-automerge-end) ---
Dependabot commands and options
You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR: - `@dependabot rebase` will rebase this PR - `@dependabot recreate` will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it - `@dependabot merge` will merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot squash and merge` will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it - `@dependabot cancel merge` will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging - `@dependabot reopen` will reopen this PR if it is closed - `@dependabot close` will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually - `@dependabot show ignore conditions` will show all of the ignore conditions of the specified dependency - `@dependabot ignore this major version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this minor version` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself) - `@dependabot ignore this dependency` will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.title: add safetensors support to convert-lora-to-ggml.py
items.body: Huggingface will save trained Lora in Safetensors format by default, Safetensors format can be easily loaded with `safetensors.torch.load_file(path)`.

items.title: Peft safetensors.
items.body:
Works by removing adapter_model.safetensors from being detected as the core model file (which skips the real peft detection).

items.title: Update safetensors and transformers to their latest versions
items.body:

- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Feature
- [ ] Bug Fix
- [X] Optimization
- [ ] Documentation Update
- [ ] Community Node Submission


## Have you discussed this change with the InvokeAI team?
- [ ] Yes
- [X] No, because not necessary. This is just housekeeping

- [ ] Yes
- [ ] No


## Description

This updates Safetensors to the new released version 0.4.2. It was released just yesterday, so I couldn't include it in my earlier Huggingface update PR. No regressions found thus far.

Edit: Mini-Update for transformers also added since it's the same ecosystem

Greetings

database in any way.
-->

items.title: Add Support for Local Models
items.body:
This PR should address Issue #10 by the introduction of using a new parameter `type` in the config to allow the use of local safetensors for SegMoE creation. 

It also contains minor bug fixes to address Issue #3 and Issue #7

items.title: Add initial safetensors implementation
items.body: This is a port of the version of `safetensors` checkpoint loading we had in the closed repo, but changing a few things around to take advantage of the new `get_model` API. This should work with any FMS model loaded from any source we have an adapter from.
